name: NOBODY SEEMS TO NOTICE NOBODY SEEMS TO CARE
description: George Carlin was so right on so many levels about American life. As he so aptly opines from one of his HBO comedy specials, "the only true lasting American value that is left; buying things". In NOBODY SEEMS TO NOTICE NOBODY SEEMS TO CARE, we take a direct quote from George Carlin and subtley place it on the screen to the point that it's almost invisible, but still visible. The metaphor here is that the truth about American Capitalism is right there just below the surface, which is that big corporations own the narrative and that our concept of free will is an illusion. I always come back to this quote of Carlin's, "the table is tilted folks; the game is rigged; and nobody seems to notice and nobody seems to care..." Think about it, not just on the surface level of the sentence, but truly take a real moment to internalized that statement. Where is the lie?
